ccesMRPprep 0.1.0

    • ACS Tables to Use for CCES and MRP

ACS code lookup table

Source: R/data_acscodes-key.R
acscodes_df.Rd

A tidy dataframe where each row is a ACS code. This is useful internal data to give meaning to variable codes e.g. acscodes_age_sex_educ

acscodes_df

Format

A data frame where each row represents a column.

variable

the ACS code (2018)

gender

A labelled variable for gender. 1 is Male, 2 is Female. Use the labelled or haven package to see labels.

age

A labelled variable specifying which age biin the variable specifies

race

A labelled variable specifying which education bin the variable specifies

educ

A labelled variable specifying which race binthe variable specifies

Source

Modifications around tidycensus::load_variables

Details

The 5-yr ACS at 2018 is used, although codes should be fairly consistent across time. IF a demographic variable is NA, that means the variable collapses over the levels of that variable. In other wods, NA here can be thought of as meaning "all".

Examples

 head(acscodes_df)
#> # A tibble: 6 x 5
#>   variable      gender       age      educ      race
#>   <chr>      <int+lbl> <int+lbl> <dbl+lbl> <int+lbl>
#> 1 B00001_001 NA               NA        NA        NA
#> 2 B00002_001 NA               NA        NA        NA
#> 3 B01001_001 NA               NA        NA        NA
#> 4 B01001_002  1 [Male]        NA        NA        NA
#> 5 B01001_003  1 [Male]        NA        NA        NA
#> 6 B01001_004  1 [Male]        NA        NA        NA
